Hello MJML
Hi Akash, How are you?

We've been busy at Atomicwork (as you might guess from this email reaching you midway through March ).We announced our inaugural CIO Advisory Board—a group of stalwart IT leaders helping us shape the future of enterprise service management with AI.
And while these conversations are in full swing, we've been shipping new features to make service management work smarter for you. Here's a look at the highlights!
Turn knowledge into action
You can now improve request deflection by identifying where the Assistant's responses fall short. Atomicwork uses insights from agent interactions and unhelpful responses to suggest improvements to your knowledge graph—so employees get the right answers next time, without your intervention.
Smarter relationships for better management
Define relationships between assets, people, and service items in a way that makes sense for your organization. With these structured links, you can better automate approvals and workflows based on pre-defined connections.
Automate changes with event-driven workflows
Now, you can trigger workflows based on any change event—whether it's a new request or an update. Set dynamic approval paths and conditions so high-impact changes get the oversight they need, while routine updates move faster.
And that's just a sneak peek at everything we worked on last month. Read our blog post for all the details and updates.
I'd love to know what you think about these features. Please do try them out and share your thoughts in a reply.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Best,
Aparna Chugh
Head of Product
